abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton meets with small business owners in Cedar Falls, Iowa, and then takes handful of questions from reporters; contrast between tone of two events points to tension between Clinton's wish to establish rapport with voters and journalists' desire to ask her questions about problems in her campaign, which is all the more heightened due to her dominance of the Democratic field.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton spoke with owners of small businesses in Iowa before taking questions from reporters.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Talks to Small-Business Owners in Iowa, Then Gives Reporters a Turn
headline.print_headline: Clinton Talks to Iowa Business Owners, Then Gives Reporters a Turn

snippet: Mrs. Clinton spoke with owners of small businesses in Iowa before taking questions from reporters.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
